instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.S5_PWR_EN: What is S5_PWR_EN? S5_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on all S5 power rails when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.ADAPTER_EN: What is ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476 no <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> no green / orange
threads.message:
Liquid <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. No other areas.

No <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>
No <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
No MagSafe

3V42 is 3V42
PPBUS 12.25

Tried SMC, no good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476 no <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> no green / orange
threads.message: SMC not running. Did you even check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>? SMC replaced or reflowed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476 no <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> no green / orange
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 36127"]SMC not running. Did you even check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>? SMC replaced or reflowed?[/QUOTE]

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is not on the board.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3


SMC:
Reflowed  SMC first.
Then replaced SMC.
Then replaced SMC a 2nd time to be sure not a shit one.... surely can't have 3 dead ones in a row.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476 no <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> no green / orange
threads.message: Yeah without <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> you are not getting a clean reset signal of course.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476 no <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> no green / orange
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 36165"]Yeah without <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> you are not getting a clean reset signal of course.....[/QUOTE]

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is back on the board.
SMC reset 3.38V
No S5 enable

threads.title: [SOLVED]3476 no <SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> no green / orange
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 36226"]PPBUS now? Green/orange light?[/QUOTE]

12.28V
No green / orange

Never mind. Sorted now.
Many Thanks.
